text: Hi, this is Wallace from Epic Games. In
this video, I will show you one of the
new features in Reality Scan 2.0,
smarter alignment.
Now, to find the setting, you go to
alignment and settings. And actually,
the default is the new smarter
alignment. Uh, you can find it here.
It's called feature detection quality,
and it is set to high. If you want to
roll back to the old alignment, you can
just set that to normal. and the feature
detection will be as it was before. Now,
here is the old alignment uh for this
data set. And you can see we got some
weird things going on. This wall along
here doesn't exist. And this wall along
here doesn't exist. And if I go down
here, I happen to know um cuz I've been
there. This door here actually should be
here. There is no hole in the wall
there. So, something's gone horribly
wrong. Um I'll just quickly turn on the
mesh. So you can have a look at like
what happened with the bad alignment and
the bad mesh. And you can see it's a
complete mess and this would take a long
time using lots of control points to try
and fix and be a big untangling
procedure. So let's have a look at what
happens just on default with the new
alignment. You can see uh we don't have
the wall here and the wall here. We'd
have the arch in the middle there. And
if I just turn on the model there, you
can see that it's meshed. But because we
are dealing with poor data, we still
have signs of a misalignment right here,
but it's way less drastic than before
and wouldn't take that much fixing. So,
uh, the golden rule is just go out and
get really good data. And actually, if
you got really excellent data, you can
use the older alignment and it will be a
little bit faster. But if you find you
run into trouble, then the new alignment
could save you a lot of hassle. Thank
you very much for watching and goodbye.
